subject: Re: Geckoinsectkillers.com.au | Credit card payment issues
preview: Hi Rosemary, If there was a configuration issue, then none of the payments would be making it through. Can you please check with PayPal. All the research I did previously pointed to a setting within

full_threads.body:
Hi Rosemary, 

If there was a configuration issue, then none of the payments would be making it through. Can you please check with PayPal. All the research I did previously pointed to a setting within the PayPal account. Let me know how it goes?
@heath Can you help me with this one?

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia assigned to Joel Maligalig

full_threads.body:
Hi Heath,

So unfortunately it hasn't solved the issue. Saw the below message in the backend on the customer order. I will log into Paypal and ask their support team.

But wondering also where it states failed business validation, is there something we need to install again on the website? I recall us having to do something before.



Thanks,

Rosemary

Hi Rosemary, 

Yes hopefully!! 

Confirming we have also removed the Pay in 4 option at the website level :)

Hi Heath,

Thanks for that, hopefully that rectifies the issue.

I also noted Gecko is the only one with a Pay in 4 option. Is this something we can remove on the backend, or does it have to be done in Paypal? As I was reading how it worked, and I don't think the business is going to like it!

Thanks,

Rosemary

Hi Rosemary, 

I have turned off the payment options on both the product pages and the cart page. So now they are only available on the checkout page. 

Let's see how it goes!

Hi Heath,

Hope you are well.

Getting back onto this one. It seems odd that it is only an issue with the Gecko website. Our accounts team advised there are no actions on the Paypal account.

So I started comparing the Gecko & Thermacell websites, and I noted Gecko has the payment option appearing on product pages, and also has a Pay in 4 option. See attached screenshots.

I did a credit card test, following the normal process one would do, and no issue found, order was successful. So I am thinking maybe its because the customers are not going to the checkout properly. I think we can rectify this by only having the payment options visible in the checkout section only.

Hope this makes sense!

Thanks,

Rosemary

Rosemary Murphy

Hi Rosemary, 

Regarding these failed transactions, it appears to be an error in the PayPal account. We can see a particular error message on the failed transactions, so searched this. We found the below thread:
https://wordpress.org/support/topic/unprocessable_entity-the-requested-action-could-not-be-performed-semantically-4/

Can you please login to PayPal an make sure any notices etc are actioned, and perhaps reach out to PayPal support for clarification. 

Regarding other payment options, we always recommend Stripe. It tends to be the most stable solution and has a great interface to 'debug' if ever required. If you can create a Stripe account, we can get that set up for you pronto. Let me know.

action.text: Joel Maligalig assigned to Heath Maguire

full_threads.body:
Hello,


We have had a number of customer stating that the credit card function is not working on the geckoinsectkillers.com.au website. The customers card is declined, but the card is working on other websites perfectly, and there is no issue with card limit. Screen grabs attached.


We had implemented an update last year with a connection to paypal to fix this issue. Looks like it is happening again. Can you please investigate?


We seem to continue to have issues with payment by credit card, should we look at an alternative payment system solution??


Thanks,
Rosemary


Rosemary Murphy
Marketing Communications Manager

Hi all

I was speaking to Leah the other day about having issues with processing a credit card payment on your website.

We have just tried again, and we are still having the issue.

Card works fine to book flights and is a company CC so I don't believe we have run out of limit.

Any help appreciated as I want to order some of you products.





Thanks

Matt
